detailsOfAchievement: DOT ARMY WIVES WELFARE ASSOCIATION (ASHA SCHOOL HISAR) FOR DIFFERENTLY ABLED CHILDREN WAS ESTABLISHED ON 10 MAY 1993. Achievements are as under (a) Conduct of National Football Meet. Special Olympics Bharat, Haryana conducted National Football Championship for Intellectually Disabled Children at Asha School, Hisar Mil Stn from 29 Sep to 03 Oct 13. Being a National event, a total of 23 states participated, which included 23 male & 13 female teams. Besides the team coaches which were part of the respective state teams, a total of 23 central coaches/ volunteers attended the event (b) Miss Sonam, a student of Primary Class Gold Medal in the National Bocce Championship, which was held from 17 to 21 July 14 at Patna (Bihar). (c) Two children participated in the National Painting Competition at Bal Bhawan, Hisar on 30 August 14, which was conducted by Haryana State Council of Child Welfare. Details of which are as under :- (aa) Miss Swati 1st Position (5-10 Years) (ab) Master Tanuj 3rd Position (d) Nine children of Asha School participated in the National Painting Competition at Bal Bhawan, Hisar on 22 August 15, which was conducted by Haryana State Council of Child Welfare. Under mentioned Children bagged the 1st posn, in different cat :-(aa) Miss Namita (ab) Miss Priyanka (ac) Master Tanuj (ad) Master Yash (e) Six children of Asha School participated in state level Spl Olympics Bharat Competitions held at Rohtak with effect from 16 Jan 2016 to 24 Jan 2016.Three children have nominated for National. Details are under :- (a) Master Kapil, S/o Mr Dalip Singh. (b) Master Sanjay, S/o Mr Mal Singh. (c) Master Lalit, S/o Mr Jai Prakash. (d) Master Kapil is likely to be nominated for World Winter Games 2017 to be held in Austria. (f) Five children of the school participated in Sate Floor Ball Championship. Two children were nominated for National Games which were held in Bilaspur from 02 Feb to 07 Feb 16. Names of children is as under :-(a) Master Lalit, S/o Mr Jai Prakash. (b) Master Sanjay (Res), S/o Mr Mal Singh (h) Master Lalit S/o Sh Jai Prakash attended the camp for volleyball on 23 Jul 16 at Rohtak and has been nominated for National Championship. (j) Two students of Asha School participated in National Championship softball held at kalinga stadium, Bhubaneswar (Odisa) wef 24 Sep to 28 Sep 16 and got 3rd posn. (a) Master Lalit S/o Sh Jai Prakash (b) Master Rohit S/o Sh Suresh Singh 2. Additional Therapy/ Facilities Created/ Added in 2015-16 (a) Photocopier machine (Xerox). detailsOfAchievement: Dr Ambedkar was a learned scholar, revolutionary and jurist who fought against untouchability and casteism. He upheld the rights of the Dalits and other socially backward classes throughout his life. He intended to integrate untouchables by providing education and exercise legal and political rights, into Indian society in modern ways. His movement provided an all -India organisation for rejection and bondage imposed upon the Dalits and our Society always work for the betterment of the society.

title: Dronacharya College of Engineering
detailsOfAchievement: Dronacharya College of Engineering, Gurgaon was established in the Year 1998. College is Approved by AICTE, New Delhi, India and is Permanently affiliated to Maharshi Dayanand University, Rohtak, Haryana. College offeres B.Tech & M.Tech courses. B.Tech has 8 courses: CSE, IT, ECE, Mech.,Civil, EEE, CSIT, Electronics & Computer Engg. & in M.Tech 4 courses : CSE, IT, ECE & Mech. Four Branches of the college (CSE,MECH, ECE & IT) were Accredited by NBA in May 2007 and Three branches were Re-accredited (CSE,IT & MECH) by NBA in Oct 2011.College is also Accredited by NAAC in Sept 2005 and Re-accredited by NAAC in March 2012. College is recognized under 12(f) and 2(b) by University Grant Commission (UGC) Act 1956. CSE, IT and ECE Departments received the highest rating in the survey conducted by AICTE - CII in 2014. College is ISO Certified for 9001-2008 and 14001-2004. College has filed 19 Patents and 42 Copyrights. College received the Outstanding Institution Award by NITTTR, Chandigarh in 2013-14. College having QEEE Center of IIT Madras, 4 star rated Remote Center of IIT Bombay / IIT Kharagpur and NITTTR Chandigarh to conduct various ISTE workshops under NMEICT project. College is Resource Centre of IIT Bombay for Spoken Tutorial Project, Active College for NPTEL (IIT Madras) Local Chapter and also developed a Lab of Control System as a Nodal Center of Virtual Lab for IIT Delhi. College signed MOU with Consultancy Development Centre (CDC), Dept. of Science & Industrial Research, Ministry of Science & Technology, Govt. of India for conduct of certificate Programme in technical consulting, International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP) for English Assessment of Students, Kyushu Institute of Technology (Japan) for Faculty Exchange Programme, WIPRO for Faculty Development Programme, College having Microsoft Innovation Center, Center of Excellence of IBM, Authorized Training Center for Oracle IT Academy, Red Hat Academy, CISCO Networking Academy & Android, C++ Academy and Google Developer Group. College has received the Best Student Branch Award from IEEE, ISTE & CSI in 2015.College has Indo US Collaboration for Engineering Education (IUCEE) Speed Chapter & Institute of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineer (IETE) Student Chapter.

address: EVAD, Chawla Colony, Ballabgarh
title: Educational Cum Vocational Association for the Disabled
detailsOfAchievement: Ours is an organization dedicated to the welfare of the handicapped section of the handicapped section of the society. This association established in 1995 has ceaselessly been working for the uplift of the impaired and the downtrodden. The EVAD has engaged itself in the activities which spread from cradle to the grave. Apart from major activities different personalized services related to the mentally retarded, the hearing challenged, visually impaired and the orthopedically handicapped prominently figure amongst others The organization has been running school for the deaf-dumb, mentally retarded and blind since 1995. Regular classes up to 5th standard are held except Sundays and festival holidays. To accomplish this task of educating the disabled special educators, teachers, speech therapist, physiotherapist has been appointed. The students who complete their education up to the 5th standard from this school are admitted to some nearby normal schools to continue their studies without any interruption. In this connection requisite help or assistance of trained teachers are available to other normal schools also. Speech therapy to remove the deficiency in speech, Speech Therapists has been appointed. They attend the mentally retarded, blind and deaf-dumb to correct or rectify any problem. With the help of different equipments and techniques the speech problem is sorted out and corrected. The students learn to pronouns from the alphabet to words and sentences fluently. Physiotherapy has also been introduced in addition to other activities with the expertise and assistance of physiotherapist different defects in holding grips, movements, touch and others are set right. There is a provision of hostel for the handicapped children who cannot come to school to attend the classes regularly. At present 25 handicapped students are enjoying the hostel. Poverty stricken children shoes parents are unable to afford for smooth education, food and transport are given priority in admission to the hostel. These students are provided with all the requisite facilities such as- reading-writing materials, school uniforms, opportunities for picnics/excursions to holy places and historical monuments. Services of library, tutorial classes at evening besides accommodation and food. A Tailoring Unit has been established for handicapped women. Trade/diploma holderâ€™s ladies are appointed to teach the handicapped women tailoring. They themselves prepared lady suits, blouse etc. with all the necessary activities of stitching. This unit has proved helpful for the women after completing the training they also earn their livelihood and take care of their families and dependents. Apart from the activities mentioned above we are also giving computer training to the handicapped students. Elementary knowledge of handling computer and different uses of computer are imparted. The students play games, solve different problems do various exercises on computers. This has been an entertaining programme for the children.

detailsOfAchievement: National Child Relief ServicesÂ plays an important part in protecting the global environment as well. A lot of awareness is created amongst the Indian people on deadly diseases like Heart Disease, Cancer, etc. for which camps are set up and run all over the India from time to time. Children living in the slums are also provided nutritious food, medicines and clothing free of cost. The other objective of the Trust is the instituting of Secondary, Primary and Middle level schools for offering free education to the poor and street children. All the support and indoctrination required are offered byÂ National Child Relief ServicesÂ while addressing epidemics related to AIDs and HIV. To agencies in the private sector, governments of developing nations and non-government organizations, the Trust provides white-collar and technical assistance as well as all-embracing training. The Trust also designs, manages and evaluates all-inclusive prevention of HIV and AIDS, offers support and care sequencers and also provides answerability in management of finances and the results of the programs, both. title: National HRD Network
actName: Section 29 of the Bombay Public Trust Act, 1950
detailsOfAchievement: The National HRD Network (NHRDN), established in 1986, is the leading National Apex body of HR professionals committed to promoting the HRD movement in the country and enhancing the capability of human resource professionals to global levels, while simultaneously enabling them to make an impactful contribution in enhancing competitiveness and creating value for Society. Over the past three decades, this institution has been built and mentored by outstanding leaders and committed office bearers who have embraced the mission of creating an unparalleled network of Human Resource professionals who can contribute meaningfully and in a value-added manner to the process of organization and nation building. NHRDN has approximately 12500 Professional Members and more than 1200 Corporate Institutional Members, with an all-India network of 30 chapters, and has global linkages with institutions like the Ross Business School, University of Michigan USA, Wharton Business School USA, Fudan University China, Society of Human Resource Management (SHRM) USA, and many others.
